description: The NLMA (NeatLittleMacApps) podcast is my tribute to those neat little Mac apps that are out there. Expect an inspired enhanced review podcast that throws screenshots at you, so fast, that you'd think it's a movie ;). Occasionally I'll be interviewing a developer and talk about his take on his software. How he came up with the idea of making it, how he made it and whether he likes milk.
title: NeatLittleMacApps

episodes.title: NLMa 058 GrandTotal
episodes.description:
Meet GrandTotal.

Feature rich but not too much of a hassle. Exactly how I like it. A great intuitive invoicing app.

episodes.title: NLMA 057 Vinoteka
episodes.description:
About this episode:
You Mac nuts all remember the wonder that was Delicious Library, not? It set the scene for an era of Mac Apps that were developed with an eye for detail and looks.
Vinoteka is a classic example of that art! Not only is it extremely userfrienly, it also looks stunning. It's apps like Vinoteka that made me start this podcast, and frankly, I'm glad I found out about it.
As for it's purpose? It's a wine management app. You can store references, actual bottles you own and tastings in it, and there will be an iPhone app for it soon. Have a sip!

Application name: Vinoteka

Developer: Vinotekasoft

Promotion in podcast:
yes, win one of 3 licenses

Brought to you by:
This episode of NeatLittleMacApps is brought to you by Vinotekasoft, creators of Vinoteka, the best wine software and cellar manager on your Mac! Find out more on Vinotekasoft.com

episodes.title: NLMA 056 StockMenulet and TwitMenulet
episodes.description:
About this episode:
This show is filled with me, begging forgiveness for being so late, and generally trying any excuse in the big book of excuses.
Oh, and there's also a review somewhere in there ;)
This episode also announces the winner of the Photomatix contest. Enjoy!

Application name: StockMenulet and TwitMenulet

Developer: Phil Chignon

Promotion in podcast:
yes, a 15% discount code for Photomatix.

episodes.title: NLMA 055 interview archive: Ze Frank
episodes.description: This is part of the archives of the Podfaded Systemtrash podcast I did together with Dimitri Larmuseau of Sourcetrunk. It's just a little amuse gueule until I get the next episode out. Enjoy!

episodes.title: NLMA 054 EvoCam
episodes.description:
Simply the best Webcam software package there is!
Oh, you don't agree? Prove me wrong (take your time).

episodes.title: Photomatix Pro Contest (repost - ipod compatible)
episodes.description:
Take your chance to win a Photomatix Pro license!

Hurry up and send us your HDR picture at contest@neatlittlemacapps.com. For more info, just listen to NeatLittleMacApps episode 53.

No luck? Get 15% of the purchase price of Photomatix Pro by using coupon code NLMA15 at checkout.

episodes.title: Photomatix Pro Contest (no episode)
episodes.description:
Take your chance to win a Photomatix Pro license!

Hurry up and send us your HDR picture at contest@neatlittlemacapps.com. For more info, just listen to NeatLittleMacApps episode 53.

No luck? Get 15% of the purchase price of Photomatix Pro by using coupon code NLMA15 at checkout.

episodes.title: NLMA 053 Photomatix Pro
episodes.description: HDR stands for High Dynamic Range. It's a technique to create vivid cool looking pictures that grab their colors and detail from a differently exposed set of pictures... Sounds difficult? It's not with Photomatix Pro.

episodes.title: Timeline 3D Contest
episodes.description:
Screenshot based on Wikipedia article.

The Timeline 3D contest is still running.

Hurry up and send us your timeline at contest@neatlittlemacapps.com. For more info, just listen to NeatLittleMacApps episode 51.

episodes.title: NLMA 052 Icon Composer
episodes.description:
For those of you freeloaders who refuse to pay good money for an app that allows you to create Icons... Here's your chance.

It appears our friends at Apple have all the tools you need, all at your disposal, for free. Isn't that nice?

And what is more. It works (what else are we accustomed to from Apple) in the most simple way possible.

episodes.title: NLMA 051 Timeline 3D
episodes.description:
Screenshot based on Wikipedia article.

Timeline 3D offers for a great way to display... wel... events! But these aren't the dull grey timelines one had to make in school. These aren't the numbing presentations where all the stuff just turns into one big pile of dates and facts.

Timeline 3D will offer you a visually stunning overview of all your timelines. With the various export features, this app will deliver you the goods, for teachers, writers, business people or students.

This episode is brought to you by Bee Docs. Again, we all know that I only review applications I personally find worth reviewing, so I dearly appreciate it when developer goes ahead and sponsors the show anyway. That said, be sure to pay a quick visit to the site of beedocs at www.beedocs.com. Visit the site not just for dowloading the demo of Timeline (which you'll need to win a free license in the episode) but also check out all possible areas where Timeline 3D really shines (education, at work, for writers and businesses). Thanks for supporting the show.

episodes.title: NLMA 050 DMG Architect
episodes.description:
DMG Architect
Style. It's what makes the difference in a lot of cases. And continuity of that style allows for good branding. And good branding is good for business... But it doesn't stop with the creation of a good nicely styled Application for example. The delivery should be nicely packaged too. DMG Architect gives you that option, no matter what the package is.

episodes.title: NLMA 049 Poladroid
episodes.description:
Poladroid.

If you want to revive the beautiful retro styled polaroids of days gone by, this is the app to do it. It's original, useful and fun to work with. A true NeatLittleMacApp.

episodes.title: NLMA 048 interview Marshall Kirk McKusick
episodes.description:
This episode I'll be interviewing Marshall Kirk McKusick. Most known for his extensive work on BSD, and in a way one of the granddaddies of our beloved OS X.
We'll be talking on how he got the copyright on the BSD Daemon (Beastie, drawn by John Lasseter), BSD in general end how to trash a computer.

Enjoy

PS.: this interview was recorded for the now podfaded Systemtras Podcast I cohosted with Dimitri Larmuseau (Sourcetrunk Podcast).

episodes.title: NLMA 047 Billings 3
episodes.description:
Usability:

If ever there was a thing that attracts me the most in Mac software, it's clean UI design and usability.

It's this thought-out approach that a lot of Mac devs have on their software. It's often the little intrinsic details that get me excited about an app. You actually 'want' to start working with it just for the sheer fun of it.

This weeks app is no different. Except,... I also need to work with it instead of just 'wanting' to work with it.

App name: Billings 3
Developer: Marketcircle
Promotion in podcast: yes, win one license of Billings 3

episodes.title: NLMA 046 Systemtrash interview Leo Laporte
episodes.description:
What's this all about?

A few years ago I cohosted this vidcast called Systemtrash. It has podfaded by now, but I had a series of interviews with some very famous people in the podcastosphere (Leo Laporte, Ze Frank, Marshall Kirk McKusick, Adam Christianson,..).

Looking back I realize that those were the beginning days of podcasting. Ze hadn't even started to do his 'The Show' series, the TWIT army just had it's first few shows to listen to. Adam practically was the only real Mac-related show in town. And I'm glad I had the opportunity to talk with these people.

Hopefully you'll enjoy these intermissions of the show. Rest assured, a 'true' NLMA episode will be coming really soon, but do keep me posted if you enjoy these interviews.

episodes.title: NLMA 045 Hazel (repost)
episodes.description:
Clean Desk policy at it's best?

Here's an app that enables you to have a robot on your system that continuously manages and/or cleans your system and trash. Uses are practically endless, but then again, so is our file clutter these days. Might come in handy not?

App name: Hazel
Developer: Noodlesoft
Promotion in podcast: no

episodes.title: NLMA 044 Open Source discussion
episodes.description:
About this episode:
This episode depicts what we podcast host go trough to get a podcast episode to you, our devoted listeners.
This show was recorded during my holiday in the south of France. I had this interview (general discussion really) with my friend Dimitri, who invited us on this great trip. So one week in a beautiful location, with a pool, lavender, wine, beer, nature all around us and what do we do? We record podcasts!
I know, it's sad ;)

episodes.title: NLMA 043 Camouflage
episodes.description:
Camouflage:

For the moments where you just don't want to see them icons cluttering your Desktop. A quick demo, some private folders visible... One click and aaahhhh. One shiny clean desktop.

App name: Camouflage
Developer: Briksoftware
Promotion in podcast: no, donationware

episodes.title: NLMA 042 Pukka
episodes.description:
Pukka: rightfully the best del.icio.us submission helper out there.
I'm not I wasn't a del.icio.us user, but I knew about this app. Funny how it goes. After a listener mentioned it to me, I tried it out anyway, and I'm now actually using del.icio.us. The world in reverse.

App name: Pukka
Developer: Justin Miller
Promotion in podcast: yes, 20% discount code

episodes.title: NLMA 041 MindNode
episodes.description:
Mindnode: mindmapping without distraction
Sometimes you just want to plot out a whole bunch of ideas that coalesced inside your mind. No bells and whistles, no distractions. Just you, your thoughts and a blank piece of mindmapsoftware.

App name: MindNode
Developer: Markus Müller
Promotion in podcast: no, freeware

episodes.title: NLMA on hiatus
episodes.description:
Hello there, loyal listener.
I’m afraid I have some sad news for you. These past few months have been really, really good for NLMA. The number of subscribers reached over 2000 a couple of times, sponsorship went well, NLMA’s were great and available in abundance.

Helas!
None of this could stop me from putting NLMA on hiatus. There is a time in ones life where he just doesn’t have time enough. This is one of those times. The reason for this sudden lack of time is the approval of the constructionplans for our home. We can now start building. I’ve decided to help out in that construction as much as possible (as if I even have a choice, financially I mean). So there you have it.

Do not despair, however (or please do, and feed my ego):
NLMA will be back! I just don’t know exactly when. I might even throw in a couple of episodes from time to time.

So thank you, thank you for all the feedback, enthousiasm, and devotion for this show.  I seriously couldn’t have done this without you listeners.

So long and thanks for the...

episodes.title: NLMA 040 SiteCrawler
episodes.description:
Unbelievably fast!
I got pointed to this app by a fervent user of it. Tried it out on my own site and was simply amazed by how efficient it was. This will be an interesting app to review.

App name: SiteCrawler
Developer: Lighthead Software
Promotion in podcast: yes (coupon code for 25% off)

Sponsored by:Lighthead Software (creators of SiteCrawler)

This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by Lighthead Software's SiteCrawler:
SiteCrawler allows you to download entire websites, parts of websites and picture galleries, so you can browse them offline. Check out SiteCrawler at lightheadsw.com.

episodes.title: NLMA 039 Picturesque
episodes.description:
OMG this is sooo cute!
I'm dying for an app that quickly lets me create the 'Apple' mirror effect. This app does this, and lots and lots of more neat effects, without getting overbloated. I like these little utils.

App name: Picturesque
Developer: Acqualia
Promotion in podcast: yes (win a couple of licenses)

Sponsored by:
Sponsored by: Outerlevel (creators of LicenseKeeper)

This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by OuterLevel:
Their 'LicenseKeeper' software is the way to go for storing all of those NLMA licenses in a powerful, fully featured, user-friendly app. Licensekeeper: keep those serial numbers safe.

episodes.title: NLMA 038 LicenseKeeper
episodes.description:
No databases, no huge costs, and very handy!
In large companies (or even for yourself), keeping up with who has which licenses can be quite a task. LicenseKeeper makes this job a lot easier, and it has some unique features I really digg.

App name: LicenseKeeper
Developer: Outer Level
Promotion in podcast: yes (win one license)
listen to the podcast: click here to get the podcast (m4a enhanced format)

Sponsored by: TheMacPak

This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by TheMacPak:
Get 10 apps for a mere 30$. Don't wait too long, since the price will go up as the apps get revealed one by one. You can support NLMA by getting this softwarebundle by visiting http://themacpak.com/nlma (site link available at the beginning of May).

episodes.title: NLMA 037 Podcast Maker
episodes.description:
And you didn't know how to Podcast?
I still remember the days that I spent hours figuring out how to create a podcast rss feed. I remember goofing around with usb mics and cheap dynamic mics. I love listening to the heaps of podcasts out there that teach you how to create a podcast. How to walk the walk and talk the talk. You'd think podcasting is hard, not? Nààààh Piece of cake with Podcast Maker!

App name: Podcast Maker
Developer: Potion Factory

Sponsored by: Embraceware

This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by Embraceware:
These guys sure know how to create beautiful and great software. It has been a while since I last checked out Awaken, (click here for archived NLMA review of Awaken) but I'm planning on revisiting this app with perhaps a whole new review. Yes, they added that much new stuff. Anyway, go and check out Awaken. This superb use of your music for everything 'alarmy' and 'timery' can't go unvisited. Check it out! Awaken: Wake Up To Your iTunes Music.

episodes.title: NLMA 036 Overflow
episodes.description:
This is my dock!

That should say it all.

App name: Overflow
Developer: Stunt Software
Promotion in podcast: yes (win one license)

episodes.title: NLMA interview Peter Schols (corrected)
episodes.description:
I know! I'm late!
But here it is... you'll hear what went wrong in this episode. Enjoy the interview!

Also, check out the interview I'll have with the developer of this great piece of software: Peter Schols. Boy do we have a scoop for you guys!

Interview with: Peter Schols (developer of Undercover
Developer: Orbicule

Sponsored by: Orbicule

This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps is brought to you with support of Orbicule: creators of Undercover and TheftSensor. Go check out some of their real life recovery stories, and see for yourself how you could avoid losing your precious Mac hardware forever. It doesn't only work, it works in a 'cool' way.

episodes.title: NLMA 035 Undercover
episodes.description:
Do you love your Mac?
I've got it easy. I'm an IT guy at quite a large company. That means, that when my Macbook gets stolen, I'll get a new one. Agreed, no one will be quite happy when that happens, but I'll be OK. But think about it. What if I personally saved up for that Macbook. What if it was my own and someone ran away with it? Oh my! Luckily there's Undercover. Just in case...

Also, check out the interview I'll have with the developer of this great piece of software: Peter Schols. Boy do we have a scoop for you guys!

App name: Undercover
Developer: Orbicule
Promotion in podcast: yes (win one of two licenses)

Sponsored by: Orbicule

This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps is brought to you with support of Orbicule: creators of Undercover and TheftSensor. Go check out some of their real life recovery stories, and see for yourself how you could avoid losing your precious Mac hardware forever. It doesn't only work, it works in a 'cool' way.

episodes.title: NLMA 034 Desktopia
episodes.description:
Customization is fun!
I'm such a customization freak. There's nothing in the world I like more than tweaking my background picture, or messing around with icons in my dock. OK, not true. I like plenty of other things more that tweaking, and I use Overflow, so no icons in the Dock anymore. But still, this app is a fun little freeware thingy. Go get it!

App name: Desktopia
Developer: Pierre Chatel
Promotion in podcast: no (freeware)

episodes.title: NLMA 033 HoudahSpot
episodes.description:
Spotlight but better!
Spotlight discussions often take place between two groups... Those who just don't use it, and those who can't live without it. Perhaps HoudahSpot will get some of that first group to change their mind?

App name: HoudahSpot
Developer: Houdah Software
Promotion in podcast: yes (promocode)

episodes.title: NLMA 032 iLike
episodes.description:
Explore music!
I know there are quite a lot of services that allow you to upload data on the music you're playing. Often you can then go and look at wht other people are listening to. Find peers in musical taste. Even listen to their music. iLike is such a service, but the integration of their iLike client into iTunes is just smashing.

App name: iLike
Developer: iLike
Promotion in podcast: no (freeware)

episodes.title: NLMA 031 iDroppper
episodes.description:
The electronic self-addressed stamped envelope!
Tired of explaining to your clients on how they can send big files over ftp? Loosing hours on the phone going over ftp-settings of a clients ftp-app? Want a quick solution? You're going to love this episode!

App name: iDropper
Developer: The Frodis Co.
Promotion in podcast: yes (coupon codes)

episodes.title: NLMA 030 Fission
episodes.description:
Edit audio the easy way!
What can I say. I'ts basic, it's clean and it's oh so easy to use.

App name: Fission
Developer: Rogue Amoeba
Promotion in podcast: yes (win a license)

This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by iDropper.
A great tool that lets you create ftp droplets with the settings of your choice. Think of it as the electronic self-addressed stamped envelope. It's the fastest, easiest, most powerful way to receive files from your customers, clients, and colleagues.

episodes.title: NLMA 029 Color Schemer Studio
episodes.description:
Color your life!
Designing sites or other stuff really depends on correct color use. You can't just throw a bunch of colors together and expect a nice outcome. This tool however will get you in the right direction.

App name: Color Schemer Studio
Developer: Color Schemer
Promotion in podcast: yes (discount code)

episodes.title: NLMA 028 Tangerine!
episodes.description:
When itunes just doesn't cut it...
I'm a sucker when it comes to mellow music (can I say this 'sucker' or is this considered as explicit?). I really am. You just go and try getting a smart playlist that gets all the soft, slow music together. It doesn't work. Ditto when it comes to the opposite. Any 'mood' related playlist really. But Tangerine! succeeds in a very original manner.

App name: Tangerine!
Developer: Potion Factory
Promotion in podcast: yes (go check out the episode... you don't want to miss this)

episodes.title: NLMA 027 Picture Framer
episodes.description:
Or how to enjoy your pictures at any moment of the day. Small, nice and very effective.

App name: Picture Framer
Developer: Monkey Business Labs
Promocode in podcast: yes (buy a T-shirt at Insanely Great Tees and get Picture Framer for free).

episodes.title: NLMA 026 Instant Gallery
episodes.description:
No fuzz, just get me those images on line.
InstantGallery definitely has a fitting name. This app gets your images on line in a very, very fast way. Create online galleries in no time with this great application. Oh, and did I mention you can win one of ten licenses for this app? Yup, come get some!

App name: InstantGallery
Developer: ThinkMac
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one of 10 licences)

Sponsored by: Insanely Great Tees
This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by Insanely Great Tees. Insanely Great Tees is the premier site of shirts made just for Mac users. We offer a lineup six retro, playful and colorful shirts, including classic Mac pixel art and original illustrations. They're all printed on super-soft 100% cotton American Apparel shirts for a contemporary fit that looks sharp and feels great, and are available for $17 apiece.

episodes.title: NLMA 025 On The Job
episodes.description:
I tried to make this.
On The Job is the ultimate Time tracking tool from the same developer that created Overflow. It's 'the ultimate' because it just bout nails it when it comes to all the functionality that I would expect from an app like this. And it remains being slick, basic and simple. I once tried to make something like this myself... Don't know why I even bothered with this around.

App name: On The Job
Developer: Stunt software
Promocode in podcast: yes (special offer discount)

Sponsored by: ThinkMac
This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by ThinkMac. They have (amongst other great apps) created the highway to online picture galleries heaven called InstantGallery. Blazingly fast creation of online picture galleries.

episodes.title: NLMA 024 IconBuilder
episodes.description:
I'm an icon lover!
I digg through sites such as iconfactory and pixelgirlpresents in search of cool icons. I love them. They're often a true work of art. And IconBuilder is the tool you need to create them.

App name: IconBuilder
Developer: the iconfactory
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one licenses)

Sponsored by: Stunt software
This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by Stunt software. Don't just sit there and read this! go and check out their (slick, beautiful,...) site. You'll find some great NLMA's there such as 'Overflow' and 'On The Job'. Good UI design combined with great usability. I believe to have developed a soft spot for this company.

episodes.title: NLMA 023 addendum
episodes.description: This is the Comic that goes with the Comic Life review...

episodes.title: NLMA 023 Comic Life Deluxe
episodes.description:
Professional comics in the blink of an eye... but there is more!
Comic Life is the coolest, most innovative-and-funny-at-the-same-time App out there. It's a super handy comic book creation app. You might go and say why would I make a comic book? Well don't see it as just a comic book creation tool, it's a new and original way of distributing your pictures, and it's fun to work with.

App name: Comic Life Deluxe
Developer: Plasq
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one of three licenses)

Sponsored by: Yazsoft
This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by Yazsoft, Check out their great Speed Download 4. Faster, easier, more powerful, and packed with more features, Speed Download 4 marks the next generation of reliable and time-saving download managers. You have to try it to believe it! Speed Download is a royal treat for all Mac Users.

episodes.title: NLMA 022 Disco
episodes.description:
The app of the year!
Are there other apps that do what this one does. Sure, heaps of them. Do they do it as good? Yup! So what's the deal then? Oh man, you're gonna love this review!

App name: Disco
Developer: Austin Sarner (together with Jasper Hauser, Jason Harris and Brian Ball)
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one of six licenses)

Sponsored by: Plasq
This episode is sponsored by the nice people of Plasq. Don't know who that is? Yes you do... They make the coolest, most innovative-and-funny-at-the-same-time app out there: Comic Life. Go and check it out at Plasq.com. It's a super cool comic book creation app. You might go and say 'why would I make a comic book?'. Well don't see it as just a comic book creation tool, it's a new and original way of distributing your pictures, and it's fun to work with it, but I won't talk about that now... I'll have to review them one of these days. Thanks for supporting the show you people.

episodes.title: NLMA Comic Life contest example
episodes.description: To give you a little nudge nudge to join the Comic Life Contest, I created a small comic as incentive to get inspired. It's not one of my best graphical performances, but hey, if you can do better, why don't you show it! The submissions can be short one page comics.

episodes.title: NLMA interview Chris Forsythe
episodes.description: NLMA interview with the man behind Growl, Adium,...: Chris Forsythe

episodes.title: NLMA 021 Growl
episodes.description:
My main brawl with open source applications in the end always boils down to the same thing. They're ugly and often not very intuitive. I'm going to get mail about this one, I know... but I'm right! I just don't see an open source operating system getting the same level of consistency as OS X for instance. And the advantage of a consistent OS is that apps that run on that OS naturally inherit that consistency. But once in a while I'm wrong. And boy am I glad I'm wrong about this app.

App name: Growl
Developer: Growl Team, led by Chris Forsythe.
Promocode in podcast: no (freeware)

Sponsored by: Plasq
This episode is sponsored by the nice people of Plasq. Don't know who that is? Yes you do... They make the coolest, most innovative-and-funny-at-the-same-time app out there: Comic Life. Go and check it out at Plasq.com. It's a super cool comic book creation app. You might go and say 'why would I make a comic book?'. Well don't see it as just a comic book creation tool, it's a new and original way of distributing your pictures, and it's fun to work with it, but I won't talk about that now... I'll have to review them one of these days. Thanks for supporting the show you people.

episodes.title: NLMA 020 CuteClips2
episodes.description:
Some people know a winner when they see one. Some computer/digital lifestyle companies know a great OS feature when they see one. And then go and implement it in their OS. Features such as CoverFlow, Dashboard, we're all clear on which company I'm referring to here. Anyway, apparently they sometimes forget to include a specific feature. I still don't know whether I like that or not.

App name: CuteClips 2
Developer: BrikSoftware
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one licenses for this app.)

Sponsored by: Brik Software

This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by Brik Software, Check out their great clipboard manager CuteClips2. One of the cleanest and most efficient Clipboard managers out there.

episodes.title: NLMA 019 Speed Download 4
episodes.description:
Speed! The fast and the furious, smokin' tires, flaming exhaustion pipes. Roaring engines, fuzzy blurry shapes rushing by. The crowd is going wild. Screaming girls all wrapped up in leather. Green, green, green... go, go, go... And if you have no clue on what all of that has to do with this Mac related podcast... You watch me go baby!

App name: Speed Download 4
Developer: Yazsoft
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one of two licenses for this app.)

Sponsored by: Yazsoft

This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by Yazsoft, Check out their great Speed Download 4. Faster, easier, more powerful, and packed with more features, Speed Download 4 marks the next generation of reliable and time-saving download managers. You have to try it to believe it! Speed Download is a royal treat for all Mac Users.

episodes.title: NLMA 018 Little Snitch
episodes.description:
It's like tracing woodworms in the old flooring. You don't really see them, but if you listen very careful, you'll hear them gnaw away at the wood. But not for long, no sir! There's Little Snitch. And all apps that try to phone home behind your back... snitched! Waaaaaaahahahahah!

App name: Little Snitch
Developer: Objective Development Software GmbH
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one of two licenses for this app.)

episodes.title: NLMA 017 Voice Candy
episodes.description:
Ok, crawling out of the deep pit of shame after last weeks episode, this ep. of NLMA will provide you with what is the core business of what we do. Deliver great content you're interested in. And woopi doo, this ep. will be great! Crazy! Funny! What else would you expect with an app like Voice Candy

App name: Voice Candy
Developer: Potion Factory
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one of TEN licenses for this app.)

episodes.title: NLMA 016 Quinn
episodes.description:
As old as the street (dunno if this is a saying where you come from, but it is in Belgium). This game might get a 'yawn' on your face, but wait up for a moment. Check this episode, and I'm quite sure you'll give it a go.

App name: Quinn
Developer: Simon Härtel
Promocode in podcast: no (freeware)

episodes.title: NLMA 015 TinyLittleMacApps 01
episodes.description:
This episode I'll review apps that are great, but too small to be reviewed in a single episode. So "Äpps in put. Put on fire. Yorn desh born, der ritt de gitt der gue, Orn desh, dee born desh, de umn børk! børk! børk!": TinyLittleMacApps. (Gotta love the Swedish Chef)

App name: EasyDMG
Developer: Michele Ferretti
Promocode in podcast: no -> freeware

App name: MiniBatteryLogger
Developer: Claudio Procida
Promocode in podcast: yes (licenses and promo code for 25% discount)

App name: Photo Drop
Developer: Aram Kudurshian
Promocode in podcast: no -> freeware

App name: Solitaire XL
Developer: Lavacat
Promocode in podcast: no -> freeware

episodes.title: NLMA 014 Delicious Library
episodes.description:
If you like displaying your CD, DVD, or books collection, so visitors stand in awe at what you've got, and you're a tidbit nerdy when it comes to classifying all those goodies... Than this is the app for you.

App name: Delicious Library
Developer: Delicious Monster
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one licenses for this app.)

episodes.title: NLMA thanks you!
episodes.description:
NLMA reaches a 1000 subscribers! YES!

NLMA is proud to announce that we have breached the thousand subscribers barrier (little dance of joy)!

My thanks goes out to all of my listeners and of course all the truly great developers who create all those Neat Little Mac Apps.

episodes.title: NLMA 013 OmniDazzle
episodes.description:
Hey, I know all apps on a Mac are fun to work with... But I do appreciate it when they're even more fun then normal Mac Apps. And then combined with some practical use. Smashin' Baby!

App name: OmniDazzle
Developer: The Omni Group
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one licenses for this app.)

episodes.title: NLMA 012 Pzizz
episodes.description:
Sometimes even a podcaster needs some time to put aside the hectic troublesome problems of the day. And behold! Pzizz let's me do just that.

App name: Pzizz
Developer: Brainwave
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one of five licenses for this app.)

Sponsored by: Brainwave

This episode of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast was brought to you by Brainwave, Check out their great Pzizz software and hardware at pzizz.com. Pzizz allows you to take quick powernaps, or longlasting deep relaxin sleep sessions trough a combination of specific audio and speech effects.

episodes.title: NLMA 011 K.I.T.
episodes.description:
Reinvented software revisited: K.I.T. (Keep It Together)
Yes, you can organize files in an orderly fashion, yes, Spotlight finds all of your files... No those options aren't good enough for me for project management!

App name: K.I.T. (1.2)
Developer: Reinvented Software
Promocode in podcast: yes
(win one of three licenses for this app, and there will also be a promo code! One generous developer.)

episodes.title: NLMA 010 Transmit
episodes.description:
Love Panic.com That's all I'm gonna say about them and one of their great apps: Transmit.

Love'em

App name: Transmit
Developer: Panic
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one license)

episodes.title: NLMA 009 b SyncupX
episodes.description:
Filling a gap in OSX's burning capabilities, and a backup solution, all reviewed in one podcast?! Ah, the niceties of owning your own media distribution has it's perks. I choose what and how many apps I review. IT'S ALL MIIIIINE!! (part b)

ehuhm.

App name: SyncupX
Developer: Freeridecoding
Promocode in podcast: yes (3 licenses for each app)

episodes.title: NLMA 009 a BurnAgain
episodes.description:
Filling a gap in OSX's burning capabilities, and a backup solution, all reviewed in one podcast?! Ah, the niceties of owning your own media distribution has it's perks. I choose what and how many apps I review. IT'S ALL MIIIIINE!!

ehuhm.

App name: BurnAgain
Developer: Freeridecoding
Promocode in podcast: yes (3 licenses for each app)

episodes.title: NLMA 008 AppZapper
episodes.description:
Uninstalling an app as easy as getting wet in a shower? Indeed, One click deletion is at our doorstep.

App name: AppZapper
Developer: AppZapper
Promocode in podcast: yes (coupon code and 5 licenses)

episodes.title: NLMA is moving
episodes.description: NLMA is moving. Not the site, but us, physically that is. So no ep. this week. But we'll get it to you as soon as possible (read: 7th of aug). Sorry about that ;)

episodes.title: NLMA 007 Sizzling Keys
episodes.description:
Ok, now I'm not going to beat around the bush here... You go get this App.
Seriously.
Get it!

As in 'NOW'!

Do I look like I'm joking here?!

App name: SizzlingKeys
Developer: Yellow Mug
Promocode in podcast: yes (first 20 users of the promocode receive 100% discount (so a free license actually))

episodes.title: NLMA 006 Feeder
episodes.description:
In the beginning there was nothing...

No wait, there was something. There was an RSS-feed creation tool called Feeder. And then there was podcasting. Ok now combine this with a developer who updates his software so fast that he must be psychic, and you get probably the best and most used podcast/rss-feed creating App out there.

App name: Feeder (1.35)
Developer: Reinventedsoftware
Promocode in podcast: yes
(win one of three licenses for this app, and there will also be a promo code! I know, I know, we're throwing stuff out here)

episodes.title: NLMA 005 High Priority
episodes.description:
No, this is not some sort of warning message telling you to give high priority to go telling all of your friends about this great podcast. High priority is a Menulet that allows you to create, edit and remove iCal ToDo's. And yes, I need this... badly.

App name: High Priority (1.11)
Developer: Aram Kudurshian
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one license for this app)

episodes.title: NLMA 004 RapidoWrite2
episodes.description:
What can I say...

It's free, it's a life saver, it's just super. This app lets you type in short text strings, only to see them replaced with whole pieces of predefined text that you added to the app. Great for replying all that mail I get from you guys ;)

App name: RapidoWrite2 (2.0.1)
Developer: App4mac
Promocode in podcast: no (freeware)

episodes.title: NLMA Iron-on
episodes.description:
Fan of the NeatLittleMacApps podcast?

Well then you better show everybody not? Go buy some iron-on transfer paper and print this PDF on it (don't forget to print it mirrored)! And then... strut the grounds dude!

episodes.title: NLMA 003 Awaken
episodes.description:
Wake up and smell the coffee??

Those days are over baby. We want tunes! And that's what this great 'alarm-wakeup-gotosleep-snooze' app gives you. Your favorite music to wake up or end the day with. (though I must admit a coffee sure helps)

App name: Awaken 2.5
Developer: Embraceware software inc.
Promocode in podcast: yes (win one of 3 licenses for this app)

episodes.title: NLMA 002 Art Directors Toolkit
episodes.description:
Art Directors Toolkit is probably the coolest compagnion an art director can wish for. What's that color again? Huh, gutter width? Is that image usabele? What page is opposite to number 45? No waiting for that Photoshop. Forget launching Indesign. Get this app.

App name: Art Directors Toolkit
Developer: Code Line Communications
Promocode in podcast: no

episodes.title: NLMA 001 Wallet
episodes.description:
Our very first application is a classic example of the type of apps we'll see passing by here at NLMA. It's called Wallet and it's a nifty app that stores all your passwords, SN's, credit card numbers etc... in a 448-bit Blowfish encrypted database. Keep an eye out for this podcast because we'll be mentioning a promocode for this one.

App name: Wallet
Developer: Waterfall Software (http://www.waterfallsw.com/wallet)
Promocode in podcast: yes

episodes.title: NLMA 000 Warming up
episodes.description: Just getting warmed up.
